title: Eve visuals
body:
Ok so for a while I've been staring at these concept arts wondering why Eve doesn't look more like them. I think they look so much cooler and would love if she got a touch up to her (imo) kind of underwhelming base model. 

https://cdna.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/007/728/108/large/gem-lim-evelynn-ingame.jpg?150812646


https://cdna.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/007/728/060/large/gem-lim-evelynn-concept-color.jpg?1508125727

https://cdnb.artstation.com/p/assets/images/images/007/728/199/large/gem-lim-evelynn-turnaround.jpg?1508126970

I would really love to see horns on base Eve, as well as fuller hair, more detailed lashers with smaller tips, and better looking shadow coverings! Personally, base Eve's skin was my least favourite part of the update. I found her lashers too big and kinda ugly, and her hair sorta looks like an onion instead of a flaming mane. That and I don't really like the way her "clothes" look. If she looked more like some of these concepts though...

Files, art style, rendering, and model issues.

Unfortunately cell shaded and art textures don't translate well to 3D when players view the characters on such a zoomed out scale. That's why Zoe looks horrifying at ground level, so she looks normal to the player. (Although I still believe she dethroned Teemo on being a demonic monstrosity from Hell)

Because too many details on a smaller model from a heads up perspective adds clutter and the like. Less can be more sometimes.

She doesn't look like this because this is mostly concept art and the images of her on the map look beautified more than functional.

When Riot designs champions, they have to make sure that what displays on everyone's screens isn't too resource intensive, has the right amount of rendered polygons and that it's very clear at what you're looking at from the usual zoomed-out/zoomed-in perspective. Clarity is a big deal in League since there's 141 champions, followed by a literal metric ton of their assets that have to be displayed on the screens and have to be distinguished enough so that everyone knows from where it comes from and whos attacks/spells those belong to.

Riot can surely render Eve's model in 4k resolution and equally beautify her but to what end?
You're never going to see her delicious belly button sheen caused by the soft moonlight reflecting on her taught, blue-tinted skin. Because it's not possible to zoom in that close and this isn't an MMO. Beautification can only get so so far before what you have before you is more distracting for gameplay purposes than helping.


There's an axiom in almost any other discipline that relates to programming/designing):
**If you're sacrificing the ease of use and functionality of a product for the sake of making it more visually appealing, you're making a bad product.**

Furthermore, look at Eve's model in-game:
Her base splash is trying to convey that her clothes are actually living shadows and not something that formed "shadowy" fabric that has some rigidity to it. The pinkish glow that comes out of her hair, nails and lasher tips is her own demonic magic. Even the color of it makes you believe that it's inviting, seductive and warm to the touch but that's all a trap for you to come too close to the flame so that Eve can "devour" you.

Everything about Eve is of her own design.
Centuries of adapting to her environment in order to capture her prey in the most unsuspecting way possible. All those details of her splash are faithfully recreated in her base model. Her shadowy clothes are actually moving around her thighs, arms and breasts and convey the idea that she can change her appearance at will and her ornamental forehead flame is moving as well. Obviously, the shadows on her legs, arms, lashers and  "lingerie" is conforming to her own shapely form but that's also because she herself wants to project that image of perfection to her potential prey. And if makes it easy for Riot to make skins for her due to having a defined model.

I love Eve's concept,but wish she looked more like in her teaser trailer.
